!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 100 Dec 31, 2002 11:47:12.688
!MESSAGE Thread not suspended, stack frame unavailable.

Fixed in #selectionChanged(...). Fix is to not log "thread not suspended" 
errors.

Couldn't the fix be to check if the stack frame is suspended..a little more 
obvious in reading the code and saves a little bit of work?

The stack frame is retreived earlier in the method, and will be null if the 
thread is not suspended. However, it will be non-null in the case of an 
implicit evaluation or while a step is taking place (that has not timed out). 
In these cases, it could be more efficient. However, the thread could still 
resume underneath us, so not logging the error is still required. 

Added suspended check to method.
*** Bug 29025 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 29188 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 29430 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: Thread not suspended, stack frame  unavailable.
